channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. cattle faces a growing threat from a protected species of vulture spreading north amid climate change — ‘They just basically eat them alive’
item.description: “Honestly, the black vulture is one of the ugliest things I’ve ever seen."

item.title: The housing market, workers, and the economy are all stuck
item.description: “It’s not healthy for the economy that people are staying put,” said Daryl Fairweather, chief economist at Redfin.

item.title: Instacart, DoorDash, Gopuff and Zip are offering discounts to SNAP recipients getting cut off from food aid payments
item.description: DoorDash said more than 2.4 million of its customers have a SNAP/EBT card linked to their account.

item.title: How to Lead During Times of Uncertainty
item.description: If ever there was a time for leaders to prove their trustworthiness, it’s now.

item.title: How to Lead With Respect in Challenging Times
item.description: The cost of contempt in the workplace is high, but the rewards of respect are invaluable.

item.title: Long lines form at food pantries after SNAP payments were suddenly cut off due to the government shutdown
item.description: In the New York borough of the Bronx, about 200 more people than usual showed up at the World of Life Christian Fellowship International pantry.

item.title: Research Shows That the Best Leaders Repeat Themselves. Here’s Why You Should Too
item.description: Leaders, if you’re getting tired of saying it, that’s a sign you’re doing something right.

item.title: Here’s why a Roth retirement account is a great gift to your future self

item.title: So long, Life360: This privacy-minded service is location sharing done right
item.description: When we talk about phones and location sharing, we’re typically talking about limiting how much info overly aggressive apps can access. But there’s an...

item.title: The Hidden Cost of ‘Fake It Till You Make It’ Leadership
item.description: Surface acting drains you, disconnects your team, and strips away your chance to lead deliberately.

item.title: This week in business: Netflix shakes up Wall Street, Amazon trims down, and shoppers gear up

item.title: 7 Ways That Leaders Can Tap Into Their Inner Motivation
item.description: When motivation feels distant, you already have access to a higher gear.

item.title: It’s not just soybeans. China also stopped importing U.S. coal amid Trump’s trade war
item.description: U.S. coal exports fell 14% from January through September compared to the same time last year, according to an EIA report released Oct. 7.
